title: Trend Function Block
description:
TREND monitors the input X and time at the output Q to see if X increases
(Q = TRUE) or X decrease (Q = FALSE). If X does not change, Q remains at
its last value. If X increases, the output TU gets for one cycle to TRUE and
at the output D the result X - LAST_X is displayed. If X is less than LAST_X
so TD gets TRUE for one cycle and the output D is LAST_X - X passed.
LAST_X is an internal value of the module and is the value of X in the last
cycle.
name: TREND

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable representing the current value being monitored.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output indicating whether the input variable 'X' has changed (increased or decreased).

output.name: TU
output.description: Output indicating if 'X' is greater than the last recorded value.

output.name: TD
output.description: Output indicating if 'X' is less than the last recorded value.

output.name: D
output.description: Output representing the difference between the current value 'X' and the last value.
